page.title: 02INVERNAVER NATURE RESERVE
page.content: The Invernaver Nature Reserve is situated just west of Bettyhill and covers 1,363 acres. It was declared a Reserve on 27 October 1960. Visitors to the Reserve are not allowed to collect specimens or disturb nesting birds, and must be careful not to start fires. The Reserve's most interesting features are the plants of the blown shell-sand, the shingle terraces in the estuaries, and the archaeological sites on these terraces. Many rare and interesting plants grow on the Reserve because of the different types of soil. Different plants like different places to live - some need wet ground, some like sandy soil and some grow on rocks. Invernaver Reserve is important because of the mountain plants which grow by the seashore.
